result.execSummary:
The defendant Austan Bardell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austan Bardell is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austan Bardell was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

1:04 P.M., Defendant Austan Bardell in court, in custody.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Burdon and defendant have received evaluation, defendant believes he is competent, State believes defendant is competent to proceed, Court finds defendant competent to stand trial, Defendant wishes to represent himself, Court goes over right to atty with defendant, Atty Burdon requesting stand-by counsel for defendant, defendant objects and now does not object, Court appoints Atty Mark Lawton to be stand-by counsel, 1:13 P.M.

Cases called:  16CF340 and 15CM629.  Defendant Austan Bardell in court, in custody with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Clifford Chase Burdon appeared for the 
State of Wisconsin.  Atty Sarbacker motions court to withdraw; has not received the signed paper from defendant yet.  Defendant confirms he does not want Atty Sarbacker to represent him any longer.  Court cites charges and penalties to defendant.  Defendant states he does not understand and requests an executor be assigned to the account.  Court denied due to nature of case being criminal.  ADA Burdon requests a competency exam; court orders competency exam be done.  Atty Sarbacker allowed to withdraw.  2:40pm/2:51pm

Attorney Sarbacker will be taking over this case, and requested it track with 16CF340.  State had no objection.  Court granted request.  This will track with other case.
